intro: Gelasine trichantha, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gelasine trichantha is often found in coastal dunes and other harsh environments, showcasing its resilience to extreme climates.
